description: Morocco's Ministry of Education suspends all in-person school activities and foreign education institutes after March 16 until further notice.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)

description: Morocco's Ministry of Education suspends all in-person school activities and foreign education institutes after March 16 until further notice.
type_sub_cat: Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)

description: Morocco declares a state of sanitary emergency on March 20th.

On March 22nd, Morocco extends state of emergency until April 20.
 UPDATE: The original state of emergency declared on March 20th did not have a specified duration. On March 22nd it was extended until April 20th.
link: Coronavirus: Morocco Extends State of Emergency Until April 20

description: Morocco suspends all flights to and from Italy on March 10 until further notice.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Morocco on March 12 suspends travel through sea and air ports to and from France, Algeria, Spain, Germany, Holland, Belgium and Portugal. UPDATE: The original flight ban on March 10 only included flights to and from Italy. On March 12 this was extended to air ports and sea ports to and from France, Algeria, Spain, Germany, Holland, Belgium and Portugal.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: After March 12th, Morocco closes their land border with Spanish enclaves of Ceuta and Melilla.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Morocco bans all flights in and out of Morocco from 30 countries after March 15, 23:59. UPDATE: The previous government restriction from March 12 banned flights from and to several European countries. The ban on March 15 extends restrictions to 30 different countries: China, Spain, Italy, France, Algeria, Austria, Bahrain, Belgium, Brazil, Canada, Chad, Denmark, Egypt, Germany, Greece, Jordan, Lebanon, Mali, Mauritania, Netherlands, Niger, Norway, Oman, Portugal, Senegal, Switzerland, Sweden, Tunisia, Turkey and the UAE..
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: Morocco's Ministry of Foreign Affairs said on March 15th that it is was suspending all international passenger flights to and from its territory after March 16 23:59 "until further notice". UPDATE: The original flight ban on March 15th extended to 30 different countries. After March 16, 23:59, this restriction was extended to all countries. No flights were allowed to enter/exit Moroccan territory.
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Repatriation flights ends for international tourists in Morocco after March 22, until further notice.
 UPDATE: The universal international flight ban effective March 16th originally allowed for repatriation flights of foreign citizens in Morocco. As of March 22, all repatriation flights of foreign citizens in Morocco were cancelled.
Morocco opens its borders to its citizens and residents abroad on July 14th
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs

description: The Ministry of Health on January 25 says Morocco has established health control at international ports and airports for an early detection of any Coronavirus imported cases.

The Moroccan government requests on March 2 that people who have traveled to a place where there is a Covid-19 outbreak stay away from public gathering places. They should self-monitor their temperature for 14 days and report to a health facility if they have any symptoms of the virus.
Morocco releases a mobile application to monitor exposition to people tested positive to Covid-19 in the last 21 days, 1st June.
Morocco is banning all exports of medical-grade face masks, effective March 2nd.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: King of Morocco orders on March 20th field hospitals to be set up across the country to assist with health services.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: King of Morocco ordered the creation of a $1 billion fund to upgrade health infrastructure and help vulnerable economic sectors to counter coronavirus spread. 185 million Euros invested in medical equipment: 100,000 testing kits. Money comes from a special fund dedicated to Covid-10 management. Other equipment bought: medication, 1,000 hospital beds, 550 ventilators and other Health Ministry functions.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Morocco, after March 31st, ramps up production of health resources for national use: Moroccan National Agency for the Promotion of Small and Mid-Sized Enterprises is set to invest $13.5 million, industrial unit in Sidi Ghanem increases output to 25,000 masks/day.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Military hospital in Benslimane province in Morocco built in preparation for an increase of Covid-19 patients. UPDATE: Original order on March 20th was for field hospitals to be set up throughout the country. This is an update for hospitals that have been built, stocked or accommodated to fit this order.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In response to the King's orders on March 20th, the province of Settat mobilizes health resources (medical, human and logistical) to hospital Hassan II.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Morocco, on April 4th, local hotels in Meknès-El Hajeb provide health resources to treat Covid-19 patients in solidarity, in response to King Mohammed VI's recommendation.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Casablanca, a new hospital was opened on April 4th at Mohammed VI University, with necessary health resources (staff and equipment) to treat 50 Covid-19 patients at a time.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: After April 6th, in Morocco it is mandatory to wear a medical mask in public spaces and the workplace.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On April 7th, daily mask production in Morocco hits 3 million. It is estimated that by April 14th this will increase to 5 million. It is suggested that part of these masks may be exported. UPDATE: The original policy increased health resource production for domestic use, on April 7th, the Ministry suggested that part of the 3 million daily masks produced may be exported to European countries.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Ivory Coast is receiving assistance from the Moroccan government. It includes eight million masks, 900,000 visors, 600,000 charlottes, 60,000 blouses, 300,000 litres of hydro-alcoholic gel, 75,000 boxes of chloroquine and 15,000 boxes of azithromycin. This on June 20th.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs

description: On March 18th, the Ministries of Health and Interior of Morocco ask citizens to limit their movement to their living space unless going into the public space is absolutely necessary.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: As part of Morocco's state of emergency declared on March 20th, authorities must provide permission for people to buy groceries and medicines and for employees of necessary sectors, such as supermarkets, pharmacies, banks, gas stations, medical clinics, telecommunications and essential freelance activities.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 21, the Ministry of Interior of Morocco announces the suspension of all intercity buses, making intercity travel only possible via trains or private vehicles, and travelers will have to undergo checks from the authorities and provide justifications for their travel.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On March 21st, the National Office of Railways (ONCF) of Morocco limits train movement between Casablanca, Rabat, and Kenitra; Casablanca and the Mohammed V Airport; and Casablanca, Settat, and El Jadida; travel to all other destinations is suspended. UPDATE: The original restriction on March 21 discontinued intercity bus services. On the same day, this restriction was extended to intercity travel via private vehicles and trains.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: After March 22, Morocco’s national carrier, Royal Air Maroc (RAM), suspends all domestic flights until further notice.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Morocco extends the coronavirus lockdown for another 4 weeks until 20th May with the same previous restrictions.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country
target_province: Casablanca-Settat; Marrakech-Safi; Fes-Meknes; Tanger-Tétouan-Al Houceima; Rabat-Salé-Kenitra; Oriental; Draa-Tafilalet; Béni Mellal-Khenifra; Souss-Massa; Laayoun-Sakia El Hamra; Dakhla-Oued Ed-Dahab; Guelmim-Oued Noun
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: Morocco extended lockdown from May 20, 2020 at six in the evening, until June 10, 2020 at six in the evening under the state of a health emergency.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Justice,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description:
Morocco extends the validity of the state of health emergency throughout National territory for a period of one month, from Wednesday, June 10, 2020, at six in the evening to Friday, July 10, 2020, at six in the evening to address the outbreak of the COVID 19 and enacting special requirements to ease restrictions gradually by regions. 
- National level: Relieved restrictions on all economic activities except on-site restaurants and cafes, bathrooms, cinemas, and theaters, etc, urban public transport with 50% capacity, maintain all the other restrictions on social gatherings.
- Mitigation Area n°1: Mobility within the territory of residence, reopening open-air public spaces, allowing individual outdoor sports,  and reopening barbershops and salons with 50% capacity.
- Mitigation area n°2: Mobility with exceptional travel license, the closing of stores at 8 pm.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Morocco extends the validity of the state of health emergency throughout National territory for a period of one month, from July 10, 2020, at six in the evening to August 10, 2020, at six in the evening to address the outbreak of the COVID 19 and enacting special requirements to ease restrictions gradually by regions. 
- National level: Relieved restrictions on all economic activities except on-site restaurants and cafes, bathrooms, cinemas, and theaters, etc, urban public transport with 50% capacity, maintain all the other restrictions on social gatherings.
- Mitigation Area n°1: Mobility within the territory of residence, reopening open-air public spaces, allowing individual outdoor sports,  and reopening barbershops and salons with 50% capacity.
- Mitigation area n°2: Mobility with exceptional travel license, the closing of stores at 8 pm. UPDATE: The Council of Government extends on Thursday, July 9, the state of health emergency across the country, until August 10, 2020, at 6 p.m.
type_sub_cat: Lockdown only applies to people of certain ages (Please note the age restriction in the text box)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Africa CDC establishes task force to oversee preparedness and response to Covid-19 called AFCOR (Africa Task Force for Novel Coronavirus).
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)

description: Moroccan Embassy in China on Jan. 25 sets up a crises team and cell to follow the Covid-19 situation of the Moroccan community in China.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Moroccan authorities created local committees to control the application of COVID 19 prevention protocol in businesses, production factories, and commercial centers, the 22 June.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: New Task Force or Bureau (i.e. establishment of a temporary body)
enforcer: New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Moroccan King, on March 20th, order cities to launch public disinfection measures in public spaces (parks, streets and taxis).
type_text: Moroccan King, on March 20th, as part of the declaration of State of Emergency, order cities to launch public disinfection programs in public spaces (parks, streets and taxis).

description: After April 4th, Morocco discontinues the repatriation of deceased bodies into Moroccan territory from Moroccan citizens abroad, from all countries.
type_text: Morocco discontinued the repatriation of deceased bodies, which was a widely available service before this announcement was made.

description: Moroccan embassy in Beijing provides Moroccan citizens in Hubei province with instructions to be repatriated or leave Hubei province.
type_text: The Moroccan embassy in China provides its citizens with a procedure to evacuate Hubei province.
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Morocco orders the repatriation of 100 Moroccan nationals from the city of Wuhan on January 27.
type_text: Morocco's King, Mohammed VI, ordered the repatriation of 100 Moroccan nationals from the city of Wuhan.

description: On January 29, the Moroccan Ministry of Health announces recommendations to avoid exposure to the virus: "wash their hands very often, cover their mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing and to avoid close contact with patients with symptoms of respiratory infection".
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On Feb 27, the Ministry of Interior in Morocco and Head of Government Saad Eddine El Othmani called on citizens to stay alert to counter fake news concerning the novel coronavirus. Several arrests have been made with regard to this warning.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On March 16th the Moroccan Ministry of Health releases a digital health campaign to advise citizens on proper sanitation procedures for work spaces, homes and hospitals.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: Morocco repatriated 167 Moroccan nationals from Wuhan and holds them in a military hospital for a 20-day quarantine. UPDATE: The original announcement was an order from King Mohammed VI for Moroccan nationals from Wuhan to be repatriated. On Feb 2, 167 Moroccan nationals were repatriated and held in quarantine in a military hospital for 20 days.
target_geog_level: A geographical or administrative unit within a country

description: On April 4th, the Ministry of Solidarity (Morroco) established 90 lodging centers for 3,000 homeless individuals, where they will spend 14 days in supervised quarantine.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Morocco closes coffee shops, restaurants, hammams, gyms and clubs to limit virus proliferation after March 16th.

Morocco fixes measures regarding the passage to the second stage of the "Quarantine Mitigation Scheme" starting from June 24, 2020, at midnight:
- National level: reopening on-site cafes, restaurants, gyms, and public baths without exceeding 50% of their capacity, as well as commercial centers and malls, public transportations between cities, and domestic flights, activities related to audiovisual and film production.
- Mitigation area n°1: movement between provinces of zone 1, opening beaches, outdoor sports spaces, and touristic institutions and activities with 50% of capacity. 
- Mitigation area n°2: movement within the residential territory, mandatory license for outside the territory, reopening barbershops and salons with 50% capacity, as well as open-air public spaces.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Military,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Moroccan committee tasked with preparing Morocco for a potential Covid-19 outbreak suggested the possibility of cancelling mass gatherings in a press release on Sunday, March 1.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Moroccan Fishing and Agriculture Ministry has cancelled the SIAM international agriculture trade fair due to the coronavirus emergency. UPDATE: Original government recommendation on March 1 was an indication that gatherings may be limited. This is the first instance on March 4 where a government event was cancelled to avoid mass gatherings.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Moroccan Ministry of Culture, Youth and Sports bans all events in which more than 1,000 people participate after March 5. UPDATE: The original declaration indicated the possibility of cancelling events, the restriction of gatherings with 1000+ people has been made official.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: The Moroccan Ministry of Endowments and Islamic Affairs announced on March 11 that it had decided to cancel all religious festivals, regardless of the size of gatherings, in the wake of the emerging epidemic of coronavirus in a number of countries.
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Morocco is restricting public gatherings to 50 people after March 14, with the exception of businesses that follow official biosafety protocols published by the Ministry of Health and Ministry of Labor. UPDATE: The original restriction limited mass gatherings to 1000+ people on March 5, it has been reduced to 50 people on March 14, with the exception of
type_sub_cat: Postponement of an annually recurring event
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
